answers.answer: I haven't. As this is my first but ive done some research as this worries me.  There is a chance of survival.  Most the organs are at least partially developed.  Possibility of health issues  And will be in the hospital in nicu likely until you were initially due. But chance of survival to atleast one year is > 80%
I'm sorry your going through this. But keep your head up and stay strong <3

I'm so sorry!   The chances of healthy and no birth defects are getting better and better the further along you go. Ask your doc about the NICU for reassurance.  Maybe you could go see it in advance so you know what to expect.  Thinking of you.
I had my daughter at 23 weeks and she's 16 now. She was only 1lb, 2oz. Hang in there, every day that baby stays on the inside, the better. Chances are very good for your little one.

Ask the Dr if they can give you a shot for the baby's lungs... My friend went in to preterm labor at 26 weeks they were able to keep the baby in until 30 weeks but they also gave her a shot to help the baby's lungs and brain develop better...wish I knew the name of it .....she had to stay in the hospital from 26 weeks until she had the baby but she was a healthy pre term baby ....didn't need to stay in the hospital either two days after delivery they both were released! I hope you have the same out come if they can't stop it completely good luck hun upkeep us posted!! I'm praying for you and your baby!!

Today my doctor will be checking to see if I've dilated past a 2 or if anything else has changed in my cervic. I've already had 2 steroids shot to help mature the baby lungs.tgose are good for 5 weeks.we are trying our best to keep the in for as long as possible. As of now she seems to weight 2.5 pound. She's still tiny but every day counts her stay inside longer.

I went through that with my last own pregnancy, I got the steroid shot at 6 1/2 mo, and was in the hospital on bed rest for 3 weeks, the shot cause gestational diabetes though, so I was on insulin shortly after the shot while still in the hospital, they sent me home with monitoring equipment and medication to stop labor and he still came about 2 weeks later at 31weeks.  Even though they told me he would be under 4 lbs, he was born 5lbs 10oz, with very little repository destress. He was even able to come home with me. Today he's a healthy 6 year old, plays football and wrestles.  But due to him they are monitoring this pregnancy very close
Good luck thoughts and prayers ur baby stays in there longer and comes out healthy.

Hi.. i had this at 19w but got a cerclage.. am on bed rest.. my advice to you - stay in bed get up only to bathe n pee. Try to get a head low bed if possible. Don't think about baby coming out she won't keep talking to her. She will stay put. Stay positive - ive sailed past this for the past 9weeks...baby dust!

I haven't dilated anymore since Friday still at 2cm & 63 % thinned out. I was told last night that I will be staying at the hospital til I'm 28 weeks which Saturday. They have been treating my diabetes due the steroids shot. But if nothing in cervix changes I might get get to go home with complete bed rest.

question: Has anyone else had a baby around this time? I went my specialists appointment 12/12/14.the ultrasound tech noticed something wrong with my cervix. Had a vaginal ultrasound & cervix was funneling. Had pelvic exam and cervix was 50% shortened and thinning out & dilating.been in hospital since being monitored. I have already had 1 shot of steroids. Next one is this evening.i never had a baby this early. 3 pregnancy but only my youngest daughter passed away in march. Been a very hard 2 years to much things have gone wrong. Would like to hear good news if my baby born this early will be ok?
title: preterm labor 27 weeks.
